Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  banana
  green apple
  red tuna

Directions:
  roast the banana
  slice the green apple
  dice the red tuna
  roast the red tuna
  prepare meal

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

-= Kitchen =-
You've just shown up in a kitchen.

You see an opened fridge. The fridge contains a diced roasted red tuna and a raw red potato. There's something strange about this being here, but you can't put your finger on it. You can see a closed oven. You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a table. The table is massive. On the table you make out a cookbook. You make out a counter. You see a roasted banana, a sliced green apple, a green bell pepper and a red apple on the counter. You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this! You can see a stove. But there isn't a thing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?

You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this! You can see a stove. But there isn't a thing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?

On the table you make out a cookbook. You make out a counter. Looks like someone's already been here and taken everything off it, though. What's the point of an empty counter? You can see a stove. But there isn't a thing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
You are in a kitchen. An ordinary kind of place. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

You can see a fridge. Classic TextWorld. The fridge contains a red onion and an orange bell pepper. Something scurries by right in the corner of your eye. Probably nothing. You make out an oven. You see a table. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a table? The table is massive. On the table you can see a knife. You scan the room, seeing a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you can make out a green apple and a cookbook. Classic TextWorld. Look over there! a stove. But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of junk. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it!

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

You see an opened fridge. The fridge contains a red onion. You see an oven. You make out a table. The table is massive. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a counter. The counter is vast. On the counter you can see a cookbook. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You can make out a stove. The stove appears to be empty. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?

messages_raw.feedback: That's already open.
messages_raw.recipe:
Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  banana
  yellow potato

Directions:
  chop the banana
  roast the banana
  dice the yellow potato
  roast the yellow potato
  prepare meal
messages_raw.inventory:
You are carrying:
  a raw purple potato
  a yellow bell pepper
  a lettuce
  a diced raw yellow potato
  a chopped banana

You find yourself in a kitchen. A typical one. You can barely contain your excitement.

You see an opened fridge. What a letdown! The fridge is empty! You see an oven. You make out a table. The table is massive. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. As if things weren't amazing enough already, you can even see a counter. The counter is vast. But the thing is empty. You can make out a stove. The stove appears to be empty. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?

messages_raw.feedback: You already have that.
messages_raw.recipe:
Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  banana
  yellow potato

Directions:
  chop the banana
  roast the banana
  dice the yellow potato
  roast the yellow potato
  prepare meal
messages_raw.inventory:
You are carrying:
  a cookbook
  a red onion
  a raw purple potato
  a yellow bell pepper
  a lettuce
  a diced raw yellow potato
  a chopped banana

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

-= Kitchen =-
Well, here we are in a kitchen.

You can make out an open fridge here. The fridge is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever! You see an oven. You see a table. The table is massive. On the table you see a cookbook and a knife. You rest your hand against a wall, but you miss the wall and fall onto a counter. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a counter? But the thing is empty. You can make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?

But the thing is empty. You can make out a stove. The stove is conventional. But there isn't a thing on it. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

You make out a closed fridge here. You see a closed oven in the corner. You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to a table. The table is massive. On the table you make out a cookbook. You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than a counter. But there isn't a thing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it? Were you looking for a stove? Because look over there, it's a stove. You shudder, but continue examining the stove. But the thing is empty. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?

messages_raw.feedback: You can't see any such thing.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.
